page.title: 18Place names around Henham
page.content: Place names in our area show the different ways such names have changed over the years.Henham was Henha in the first Domesday Book and has changed through Anham,Enham,Henhame to Henham. The name comes from Hean=high and Ham= settlement and means "at the place of the high ham".Locally the village has been called Henham-on-the-Hill.Ugley takes its name from a local chief Ucga.Ley means a clearing so Ugley means "Ucga's clearing'.The village also has been called Oakley,perhaps because Ugley is not a very complimentary name for a lovely village.Old Mead runs between Henham and Ugley.It takes its name from Ralph atte Mead who lived around 1327.
